meanings.definition: To turn or roll around on an axis
meanings.sent1: The Earth will volve around the sun.
meanings.sent2: I watch the washing machine volve as it cleans my clothes.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to volve in circles before lying down for a nap.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to volve faster as we grow older.
meanings.sent5: The merry-go-round made the children dizzy with its constant volve.

meanings.sent1: The windmill blades volve gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The planets volve around the sun in our solar system.
meanings.sent3: The dancer's skirt seemed to volve with her every move.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the clock volve smoothly to keep time ticking.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of the bicycle volve as the rider pedals forward.

meanings.sent1: The snake will volve around its prey before striking.
meanings.sent2: She watched the yarn volve into a neat ball as she knitted.
meanings.sent3: The vines volve around the tree trunk like a natural scarf.
meanings.sent4: The gymnast's body seemed to volve effortlessly in mid-air.
meanings.sent5: The rope began to volve around the pole as the flag was raised.

meanings.sent1: She will volve the scarf around her neck to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: The ivy plants volve around the old stone walls of the castle.
meanings.sent3: The ribbon seemed to volve itself around the gift box magically.
meanings.sent4: The river will volve around the bend before disappearing from sight.
meanings.sent5: The spider silk will volve around the prey to secure its catch.

meanings.definition: To change or shift in a circular motion
meanings.sent1: The colors of the kaleidoscope volve with each twist.
meanings.sent2: Her thoughts volve endlessly in her mind, never settling.
meanings.sent3: The ballerina's pirouette made her costume volve beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds volve ominously in the sky before the rain.
meanings.sent5: The carousel horses volve up and down as the music plays.
